channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Tourism chief’s son among stranded in Palawan
item.description: Tourism Secretary Bernadette Romulo-Puyat’s son is among the domestic travelers stranded in Palawan amid the enhanced community quarantine.

item.title: Agencies told to draft guidelines on possible resumption of mass transport
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: "So it will be a new norm. You may no longer have a seatmate in buses. No one will stand in buses and even in queues, there should be social distancing. But the President will still decide on this," Roque said.

item.title: DOH launches KIRA, the KontraCOVID chatbot
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: KIRA is accessible through the DOH Facebook page, the agency’s Viber community and kontracovid.ph.

item.title: Palace 'hopeful' China will keep promise of no further reclamation in West Philippine Sea
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "The promise of China that we are hoping they will fulfill is that there will be no new reclamation done because the problem should not worsen when it comes to reclamation," Roque said in a mix of English and Filipino.

item.title: 2019 Bar exam results to be released online on April 29
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Unlike release of passers list in recent years, the names of the successful Bar takers will only be uploaded in the SC website due to measures being enforced to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.

item.title: All IDs issued by COVID-19 task force should be honored — Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: While the government is implementing the RapidPass System, checkpoint personnel should honor the identification cards issued previously by the Inter-Agency Task Force on the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases, Malacañang said Thursday.

item.title: Wescom: Chinese ship showed 'hostile intent' in February incident with BRP Conrado Yap
item.author: Roel Pareño
item.description: Vice Admiral Rene Medina, commander of WesCom and of Joint Task Force West, said the February 17 incident was reported by the commanding officer of BRP Conrado Yap.

item.title: FLAG asks police to reconsider 'arrest without warning' directive
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: FLAG said this order from the police chief “appears to give the police the green light to arrest ‘ECQ violators’ even if the grounds for a lawful warrantless arrest are not present.”

item.title: Gov't repression of rights a common ASEAN trend amid pandemic — think tank
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "Most of the countries are issuing emergency decrees and not providing solutions for people living in poverty, and this increases social unrest."

item.title: IATF seeks protocols for management and surveillance of repatriated OFWs
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: More than 16,000 OFWs have been repatriated, majority of them seafarers.
